Sentence.sentence: They have changed the previous migration habits of certain birds.

Sentence.sentence: Racial terms are still useful in certain fields of study.

Sentence.sentence: There are certain products andservices that are very suitable for selling online, and others that simply don’t work.

Sentence.sentence: But economists who study the relationship between money and happiness have consistently found that, above a certain income, the two do not reliably correlate.

Sentence.sentence: Certain conclusions are nonetheless clear

Sentence.sentence: First, we decide whether we are superior or inferior to others on certain dimensions, such as attractiveness, intelligence, popularity, etc.

Sentence.sentence: At certain stages of life, especially adolescence, the pressure to be seen as similar to peers is immense

Sentence.sentence: On occasions it is the fear that certain disclosures may be unacceptable to family or friends that motivates an individual to seek professional help.

Sentence.sentence: But what is certain is that, in some way or other, Google's entrance into digital book selling will have a significant impact on the book world in the years to come

Sentence.sentence: It enhances immunity to certain diseases

Sentence.sentence: Workers have the legal rights to refuse certain unsafe work assignments under two federal laws: the Occupational Safety and Health Act and the National Labor Relations Act.

Sentence.sentence: And grass-fed dairy and meat have been shown to be higher in certain nutrients and healthy fats.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: But even without gadgets that understand our spoken commands, research suggests that, as bizarre as it sounds, under certain circumstances, people regularly ascribe human traits to everyday objects.

Sentence.sentence: But there are certain situations that do warrant extra protein.

Sentence.sentence: Flight attendants, firefighters, and police officers have to be over a certain height, and be physically fit.

Sentence.sentence: When a tree first starts growing in a certain area, it's likely that the 27 climatic envelope—the temperature, humidity, rainfall patterns and so on—suits it.

Sentence.sentence: However, there are certain advantages of public universities, such as the fees being free.

Sentence.sentence: I'm certain of it, absolutely, especially if it's difficult for a competitor to copy.

Sentence.sentence: In fact, they are prescribed and they're given at a certain level, a dosage that is understood by a practitioner who's been trained.

Sentence.sentence: It is certain that the Census procedures, which lump the online sales of major traditional retailers like Walmart with "'non-store retailers" like food trucks, can mask major changes in individual retail categories.

Sentence.sentence: Joseph has learned that a farmer has to have a certain mindset to successfully convert.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: So it was pretty certain that the enemy would not be able to understand the code talkers.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题(第二套)听力 Section B

Sentence.sentence: The developing brain, the report says, is particularly vulnerable to the toxic effects of certain chemicals these products may contain, and the damage they cause can be  permanent.
Sentence.come: 2015年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section A

Sentence.sentence: There are certain products and services that are very suitable for selling online, and others that simply don't work.
Sentence.come: 2015年12月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: When they detect an extended dry period, they divert their metabolisms, producing sugars and certain stress- associated proteins and other materials in their tissues.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: without sustained external pressure it seems certain Mr. Cameron would still be hooked on the interests of big tobacco companies
Sentence.come: 2016年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section C

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均含"无疑的，确信的"之意。
means: sure ： 侧重主观上对某事确信无疑。
certain与sure同义，但语气比sure强，着重指有确切理由或不容置疑的证据所支持的确信。
definite ： 指已毫无怀疑的余地。
positive ： 语气强烈，指对自己的看法或作的结论的正确性有不可动摇的信念。

list.explanation: (总与a连用)某人(即我不希望提及其名，而你却可猜着此人是谁)

example.en: I spoke to a certain party about the matter you mentioned.
example.zh: 关于你所提及的事，我已对某人说过了。

stems_affixes.word_buile: cert搞清,区别+ain表示形容词→搞清楚的→肯定的
certain[adj.肯定的]+ty表名词→n.必然,肯定;必然的事
cert搞清,区别+itude状态→确定状态
con共同+cert搞清,区别→一致,和谐→音乐会
cert搞清,区别+ify表动词→搞清楚→证明

Sentence.sentence: Up to a certain point, the more stress you are under, the better your performance will be.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语上海卷 语法填空 B 原文

sentences.en: His ear for music was certain.
sentences.cn: 他对音乐的鉴赏力毋庸置疑。

sentences.en: That we should stay together was certain.
sentences.cn: 我们应该呆在一起这是肯定的。

sentences.en: It is more or less certain.
sentences.cn: 这有几分确定。

sentences.en: After the Boston Tea Party, war with England seemed certain.
sentences.cn: 波士顿倾茶事件以后, 与英国交战似乎是不可避免的。

sentences.en: We are certain to win the game.
sentences.cn: 我们一定能打胜这场比赛。

sentences.en: The people of the afflicted areas are certain to need our help.
sentences.cn: 灾区人民一定需要我们的帮助。

sentences.en: The duties before you are certain to be heavy.
sentences.cn: 摆在你面前的责任重大。

sentences.en: We are certain to be victorious.
sentences.cn: 我们定会胜利。

sentences.en: The thief is certain to be caught in time.
sentences.cn: 小偷迟早会被抓到的。

sentences.en: You are pretty certain to be seen by someone who knows you.
sentences.cn: 你一定被认识你的人见到过。

sentences.en: We are certain that he will get over his illness.
sentences.cn: 我们相信他一定会战胜病魔的。

sentences.en: He is certain that this TV set will operate on batteries.
sentences.cn: 他肯定这个电视机可以用电池。

sentences.en: Be certain you catch your train on time.
sentences.cn: 务必准时赶上火车。

sentences.en: I'm certain she saw me yesterday.
sentences.cn: 我确信她昨天看到了我。

sentences.en: I was certain I'd found you here if you were still in existence.
sentences.cn: 我确信如果你还活着的话, 我会在这儿找到你。

sentences.en: I am not certain who he is.
sentences.cn: 我无法确切说出他是谁。

sentences.en: I'm not certain where this ought to be put.
sentences.cn: 我不能确定这东西该放在什么地方。

sentences.en: It is certain he will come to the discussion.
sentences.cn: 他肯定会来参加讨论。

sentences.en: It is not yet certain who will succeed him.
sentences.cn: 谁来接他的班还未确定。

sentences.en: It is not certain when it will take place.
sentences.cn: 不能确定这事什么时候会发生。

sentences.en: A certain Mr. Brown telephoned while you were out.
sentences.cn: 你出去的时候, 有个叫布朗的先生来过电话。

sentences.en: The terrorists will only release their hostages on certain conditions.
sentences.cn: 恐怖分子只有在某些条件下才肯释放人质。

sentences.en: There are certain forms that must be followed in diplomatic circles.
sentences.cn: 在外交界有一些礼节是必须遵守的。

sentences.en: I am prepared to make certain concessions.
sentences.cn: 我准备做某些让步。

sentences.en: There was a certain hesitation in her manner.
sentences.cn: 她的态度有些犹豫不决。

sentences.en: If you want to be slim, you should try to lose a certain amount of weight every week.
sentences.cn: 如果想变得苗条些的话, 你应该想方设法每周减少点体重。

sentences.en: She has certain definite beauties, such as her eyes.
sentences.cn: 她确有几分姿色, 比如说她的眼睛。

sentences.en: There is no certain cure for this disease.
sentences.cn: 这种病没有特效药。

sentences.en: They face certain death unless they can be rescued today.
sentences.cn: 他们除非今天获救, 否则必死无疑。

sentences.en: The club meets on certain days every month.
sentences.cn: 俱乐部成员每月于某些天聚一次。

data.mean: （不提及细节时用）某事，某人，某种
make certain (that…) 弄确实；弄清楚；弄明白

sentence.cn: 但有一件事是肯定的，所有的人在他们的生活中都会遭遇高山险阻。
sentence.en: But one thing is certain,  all people encounter mountains in their life.
sentence.from: 2018年高考英语天津卷 阅读理解 阅读表达 原文

sentence.cn: 试图帮助受伤、流离失所或生病的生物可能令人心碎;生存的可能性永远是不确定的。
sentence.en: Trying to help injured,  displaced or sick creatures can be heartbreaking; survival is never certain.
sentence.from: 2017年高考英语全国卷1 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

jx.jx_en_mean: [with clause]take action to ensure that something happens or is the case
jx.jx_cn_mean: （采取行动）确保（某事发生）；查实（某事），查明（某事属实）

entry.def: If you are certain about something, you firmly believe it is true and have no doubt about it. If you are not certain about something, you do not have definite knowledge about it.
entry.tran: 肯定的;有把握的;毫无疑问的

example.ex: She's absolutely certain she's going to make it in the world...
example.tran: 她坚信自己会出人头地。

example.ex: We are not certain whether the appendix had already burst or not...
example.tran: 我们不敢肯定阑尾是否已经破裂。

entry.def: If you say that something is certain to happen, you mean that it will definitely happen.

example.ex: However, the scheme is certain to meet opposition from fishermen's leaders...
example.tran: 然而，这项计划一定会遭到渔民领袖的反对。

example.ex: It's not certain they'll accept the Front's candidate if he wins...
example.tran: 即便来自阵线的候选人获胜，他们能否接受他还说不准。

entry.def: If you say that something is certain, you firmly believe that it is true, or have definite knowledge about it.

example.ex: One thing is certain, both have the utmost respect for each other...
example.tran: 有一点可以肯定，那就是双方都非常尊重对方。

example.ex: It is certain that Rodney arrived the previous day.
example.tran: 罗德尼肯定是头天到的。

entry.def: If you have certain knowledge, you know that a particular thing is true.

example.ex: He had been there four times to my certain knowledge.

entry.def: If you know something for certain, you have no doubt at all about it.

example.ex: She couldn't know what time he'd go, or even for certain that he'd go at all...
example.tran: 她不知道他何时走，就连他到底走不走都说不准。

example.ex: Hill had to find out for certain.

entry.def: If you make certain that something is the way you want or expect it to be, you take action to ensure that it is.

example.ex: Firstly, they must make certain that their pension needs are adequately catered for...
example.tran: 首先，他们得确保他们能获得足够的养老金。

example.ex: To make extra certain, a police helicopter kept watch from the skies.
example.tran: 为确保万无一失，一架警用直升机一直在空中警戒。

entry.def: You use certain to indicate that you are referring to one particular thing, person, or group, although you are not saying exactly which it is.

example.ex: There will be certain people who'll say 'I told you so!'...
example.tran: 一定有人会说：“我怎么跟你说来着！”

example.ex: You owe a certain person a sum of money...

entry.def: When you refer to certain of a group of people or things, you are referring to some particular members of that group.

example.ex: They'll have to give up completely on certain of their studies.
example.tran: 他们将不得不彻底放弃某些研究。

entry.def: You can use a certain before the name of a person in order to indicate that you do not know the person or anything else about them.
entry.tran: (用于人名前，表示不认识或了解很少)某个

example.ex: She managed to arrange for them to be hidden in the house of a certain Father Boduen.
example.tran: 她设法安排他们藏在一个叫博迪恩的神父家里。

entry.def: You use a certain to indicate that something such as a quality or condition exists, and often to suggest that it is not great in amount or degree.
entry.tran: (品质、特点等)一定程度上的，有点儿

example.ex: That was the very reason why he felt a certain bitterness...
example.tran: 那就是为什么他感到有些痛苦。

example.ex: There is a certain impatience among some of the soldiers...
example.tran: 有些士兵有点儿不耐烦。

means.word_mean: 1. definite but not specified or identified;

sentences.sentence: "set aside a certain sum each week"
"certain breeds do not make good pets"
"certain members have not paid their dues"

means.word_mean: 2. having or feeling no doubt or uncertainty; confident and assured;

sentences.sentence: "was sure (or certain) she had seen it"

means.word_mean: 3. established beyond doubt or question; definitely known;

sentences.sentence: "what is certain is that every effect must have a cause"
"it is certain that they were on the bus"
"the date for the invasion is certain"

means.word_mean: 4. certain to occur; destined or inevitable;

sentences.sentence: "In this life nothing is certain but death and taxes"- Benjamin Franklin
"a sure way to distinguish the two"
"wood dust is a sure sign of termites"

means.word_mean: 7. exercising or taking care great enough to bring assurance;

sentences.sentence: "be certain to disconnect the iron when you are through"

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French, based on Latin certus 'settled, sure'

means: 某些（不提及人或事物的名称时用）

sentences.cn: 你对这事绝对确信无疑吗？
sentences.en: Are you absolutely certain about this?

sentences.cn: 我无法确定谁当时在场。
sentences.en: I'm not certain who was there.

sentences.cn: 我敢肯定他当时在别处。
sentences.en: To my certain knowledge he was somewhere else at the time (= I am sure about it) .

sentences.cn: 由于某种个人原因，我将不能出席。
sentences.en: For certain personal reasons I shall not be able to attend.

sentences.cn: 某些人对这事可能不会赞同。
sentences.en: Certain people might disagree with this.

sentences.cn: 除非某些条件得到满足，否则他们不会释放人质。
sentences.en: They refused to release their hostages unless certain conditions were met.

sentences.cn: 是一位叫戴维斯的医生做的手术。
sentences.en: It was a certain Dr Davis who performed the operation.

sentences.cn: 在一定程度上的确如此。
sentences.en: That's true, to a certain extent .

sentences.cn: 要想有把握买到票，现在就得预订。
sentences.en: If you want to be certain of getting a ticket, book now.

sentences.cn: 她不敢肯定他见过她。
sentences.en: She wasn't certain (that) he had seen her.

sentences.cn: 救援行动如果今天不能成功，登山队员必死无疑。
sentences.en: The climbers face certain death if the rescue today is unsuccessful.

sentences.cn: 他们肯定会同意。
sentences.en: It is certain that they will agree/They are certain to agree.

sentences.cn: 看来奥斯卡金像奖非她莫属。

sentences.cn: 而这种传闻性的证据正与“只有某些特殊人物才能推动潮流”的观点相契合。
sentences.en: Anecdotal evidence of this kind fits nicely with the idea that only certain special people can drive trends.

sentences.cn: 通过实验和观察，像伯宁博士这样的社会科学家们发现，通过大量无休止的广告将某些行为与习惯性暗示联系起来的做法是有效的。
sentences.en: Through experiments and observation, social scientists like Dr. Berning have learned that there is power in tying certain behaviors to habitual cues through relentless advertising.
